item.title: Gold’s for City of Sheffield’s Maisie Bond at Camo Invitational Diving Competition
item.dc:creator: Sarah Small
item.description:
Over the past couple of days, Swim England divers have been enjoying success at the Camo Invitational in Canada. On the first day of the competition, City of Sheffield’s Maisie Bond set a new personal best as she joined Crystal Palace’s Jack Jefford on top of the podium at the Claude Robillard Sports Complex, in […]

The post Gold’s for City of Sheffield’s Maisie Bond at Camo Invitational Diving Competition appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Over the past couple of days, Swim England divers have been enjoying success at the Camo Invitational in Canada.

On the first day of the competition, City of Sheffield’s Maisie Bond set a new personal best as she joined Crystal Palace’s Jack Jefford on top of the podium at the Claude Robillard Sports Complex, in Montreal.

Maise was 35.25 points ahead of second-placed Heloa Camelo, of Brazil, after scoring an impressive 283.95 in the Girls’ C 1m Springboard. Her team mate, Jenna Davison was 19th in the preliminary round and missed out on a place in the final.

Suzie Collins, Swim England Talent Development Officer Diving, said: “It’s been a great opening day for the team and fantastic to hear the national anthem ringing around the Claude Robillard Sports Complex twice.

We’re really settled in now and looking forward to getting the Group Bs on the platform.”

On the second day of competition, Masie was once again on the top of the podium, leading from start to finish in the Girls’ C Platform competition, saving her best dive until last.

Her back two-and-a-half somersaults tucked from the 7m board earned her nines and ensured she smashed through the 300-point mark.

Maisie’s total of 305.25 was 42.45 points ahead of Germany’s Lena Philin Schneider, who took the silver medal while Jenna Davison was sixth on 298.60.

The post Gold’s for City of Sheffield’s Maisie Bond at Camo Invitational Diving Competition appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: North East Region U14 Girls Water Polo Team – Swim England Inter-Regional Champions 2019
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
The North East 2006+ Girls team competed at the Inter Regions in Walsall on 30th November and the 1st Dec 2020. The team’s Head Coach, Kevin Swainson, reports: “We had our team talk before the first match and set out our tactics for the weekend.  I felt that if we played as a team, not […]

The post North East Region U14 Girls Water Polo Team – Swim England Inter-Regional Champions 2019 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
The North East 2006+ Girls team competed at the Inter Regions in Walsall on 30th November and the 1st Dec 2020.

The team’s Head Coach, Kevin Swainson, reports:

“We had our team talk before the first match and set out our tactics for the weekend.  I felt that if we played as a team, not as individuals, we had a very good chance of a medal.

Going into the competition I was confident in our team, with two very capable Centre Backs in Connie and Amelia I felt that we could ball line press in defence and put allot of pressure on the attacking team. We had worked hard on this in the last few weeks and it paid dividends at the weekend only conceding 17 goals in the whole tournament and causing the attacking teams allot of problems. 

This was complimented by our scoring capabilities; we played excellent as a team in attack with very good, unselfish water polo from the whole team resulting in every single player scoring during the weekend.   This included taking advantage of the new rules and allowing our goalkeeper to join the attack.  Severn came out to attack three times and we scored on all three occasions including two goals from our goalkeeper Severn which I think was one of the highlights of the whole weekend for the whole team. We managed 75 goals in 6 matches, that is 17 more than any other team in the competition.

The semi-final against North West was a fantastic match and in fairness the score did not reflect how close the match was, the girls started fantastic against the tournaments number one seed and showed grit and determination for the full match.

The final was a re-match of our earlier encounter with Ireland, Ireland had won the first time 7-4 but we felt that this could be a result that we could turn around.  Ireland came at us very strong, frustrating our players in attack and forcing us to rush and make mistakes.  With the score line at 5-2 down with only 3 minutes left on the clock some teams would have given up but the girls showed grit, determination and heart to score 3 times in the last 3 mins to take the match to penalties.

No one likes a penalty shootout but the girls although extremely nervous performed fantastic, good penalties taken by all the players and Severn managing to pull off two fantastic saves won us the title.

Congratulations to Laura who won team MVP, Tournament MVP and top goal scorer in the tournament.

Special thanks to Gabby, Liz and Michelle for your help at the weekend and for your assistance in the weeks building up to the competition.

Thank you to the parents for your support during the weekend, without your support we would not be the team we are.

And last but probably the most important, thank you to the players for the effort you all put it to make this weekend such a success and so enjoyable.  The team not only worked well together in the pool they all got on so well outside the pool and on behalf of myself, gabby and Liz I would like to wish the team a long and successful future in the sport.”

The Team included:

Severn Annakin – St bede’s and st joseph’s catholic college
Amelia Hendesron – Sedgefield WPC
Ruby Taylor – City of Sheffield WPC
Connie Swainson – Rotherham Metro WPC
Lilly Pryce – St bede’s and st joseph’s catholic college
Lola Carver-Brown – Rotherham Metro
Caitlin Urqhuart – City of Sheffield WPC
Laura Skelton – Rotherham Metro
Amelia Brooksbank – St bede’s and st joseph’s catholic college
Isobel Olcer – Rotherham Metro WPC

Results

North east Steelers     26 – 0 Wales

North east Steelers     4 – 7 Ireland

North east Steelers     16 – 0 East Midland

North east Steelers     14 – 1 South East

Semi Final

North east Steelers     10 – 4 North West Thunder

Final

North east Steelers     8 – 6 Ireland (After Penalties)

Well done, congratulations and thanks to all involved for your achievement.

The post North East Region U14 Girls Water Polo Team – Swim England Inter-Regional Champions 2019 appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Northumberland and Durham Masters Swimmers at Inter County Competition
item.dc:creator: Sarah Small
item.description:
On the 10th November 2019, 24 Northumberland and Durham masters swimmers travelled to Huddersfield for the masters inter counties where the Northumberland and Durham team finished in 16th position. It was a fantastic  performance by the team, with many swimmers competing in up to 10 events! There was only one event in which the team […]

The post Northumberland and Durham Masters Swimmers at Inter County Competition appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
On the 10th November 2019, 24 Northumberland and Durham masters swimmers travelled to Huddersfield for the masters inter counties where the Northumberland and Durham team finished in 16th position.

It was a fantastic  performance by the team, with many swimmers competing in up to 10 events! There was only one event in which the team didn’t have a swimmer, the ladies over 75.

The next masters competition is at the end of January 2020 in Carlisle. Full results from the competition in Huddersfield can be found here.

The post Northumberland and Durham Masters Swimmers at Inter County Competition appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Easyfundraising Webinar – free funds for clubs!
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Don’t miss out on this opportunity to hear about how to get free funding for your aquatics club through everyday online shopping with 4000+ retailers including Trainline, Booking.com, Amazon, eBay, John Lewis and Partners and Sainsbury’s. Find out how to fund equipment for your club, raise funds for an event or fund coaching qualifications just […]

The post Easyfundraising Webinar – free funds for clubs! appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Don’t miss out on this opportunity to hear about how to get free funding for your aquatics club through everyday online shopping with 4000+ retailers including Trainline, Booking.com, Amazon, eBay, John Lewis and Partners and Sainsbury’s.

Find out how to fund equipment for your club, raise funds for an event or fund coaching qualifications just by shopping online.

To help you to make the most of the scheme, Easyfundraising are hosting a short webinar where they will share:

* how other clubs have been successful
* how you can utilise the free resources available
* and some tips for fundraising success.

 

There are three opportunities to see the webinar: Click on a date to register or Visit – https://www.easyfundraising.org.uk/swim-england-webinars

5th December – 1:00pm,

5th December – 7:30pm

11th December – 12:00pm

If your aquatics club isn’t yet signed up with easyfundraising, or to find out more simply visit www.easyfundraising.org.uk/swim-england  to register for your free account.

Post expires at 10:37am on Friday December 6th, 2019

The post Easyfundraising Webinar – free funds for clubs! appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: North East Region Swimming Coaches Conference 2020 – Save the date!
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
A Swim England North East Region Swimming Coaches Conference, in partnership with the Swim England Talent Team, will take place on Sunday 15th March 2020 at the Bridge Inn Hotel near Wetherby. The conference will cover various topics including: Optimum Athlete Development Framework The Club Awards programme Developing the characteristics of the future performance potential […]

The post North East Region Swimming Coaches Conference 2020 – Save the date! appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
A Swim England North East Region Swimming Coaches Conference, in partnership with the Swim England Talent Team, will take place on Sunday 15th March 2020 at the Bridge Inn Hotel near Wetherby.

The conference will cover various topics including:

  • Optimum Athlete Development Framework
  • The Club Awards programme
  • Developing the characteristics of the future performance potential person
  • Athlete’s transitioning through the daily training environment pathway
  • Coaches Corner to help problem solve

The speakers for the day will include experienced coaches, Sports Psychologists, members of the Swim England Talent Team, elite athletes and UK Coaching staff.

Further details, including how to book, will be announced in due course.

Post expires at 11:10am on Sunday March 15th, 2020

The post North East Region Swimming Coaches Conference 2020 – Save the date! appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Regional Swimming Camps 2019
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
The third and final Swim England North East Region Swimming Camp for 2019 took place at Catterick Leisure Centre on Sunday 24th November 2019. The camps form part of the North East Region Performance Programme and provide an opportunity for swimmers to develop their technical, tactical, physical and psychological skills with swimmers of a similar […]

The post Regional Swimming Camps 2019 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
The third and final Swim England North East Region Swimming Camp for 2019 took place at Catterick Leisure Centre on Sunday 24th November 2019.

The camps form part of the North East Region Performance Programme and provide an opportunity for swimmers to develop their technical, tactical, physical and psychological skills with swimmers of a similar age and ability from across the region. The camps also provide an opportunity for swimmers to work with different coaches and to train in different environments and provide a stepping-stone to progress to further camps in the future. The camps engaged with athletes in the 12 year old age group.

Each of the camps was led by Head Coach, Chris Dove with the support and assistance of several Skills Coaches and Team Managers from across the region. Also in attendance to deliver specific sessions at different camps were Strength & Conditioning coaches, a Sports Psychologist and a Nutritionist.

The feedback received is that the camps have been a positive and rewarding experience for all involved.

Any coaches who would like to be considered to be part of future camps as a development opportunity should refer to the Coach Development Pathway document which is available to view at: https://asaner.org.uk/mdocs-posts/sener-coach-development-pathway-october-2019/

 

The post Regional Swimming Camps 2019 appeared first on Swim England North East.
